itineraries.title: WILD HOKKAIDO: SMOKING VOLCANOES, LAVENDER AND MARINE GASTRONOMY
itineraries.notes: Découvre la nature préservée de l'île la plus septentrionale du Japon entre champs de lavande de Furano, paysages patchwork de Biei, zoo innovant d'Asahikawa et gastronomie marine exceptionnelle de Sapporo. Un Japon différent aux influences aïnous et aux paysages grandioses où la neige règne six mois par an.

visits.text: Otaru Canal — Historic 1.3-kilometer canal built between 1914 and 1923 for maritime transport, lined with red brick warehouses converted into shops and restaurants, 63 vintage gas lamps lit at dusk creating romantic atmosphere, iconic Asakusa bridge, winter stroll with snow sculptures, symbol of past port prosperity.

Sakaimachi Street — Historic 900-meter shopping street preserving Meiji and Taisho architecture, 70 shops in renovated century-old buildings, specialty Otaru Orgel-do music boxes with 25,000 models on display, mouth-blown artisanal glassware, LeTao pastries famous for double cheese, nostalgic 1920s atmosphere.

Otaru Music Box Museum — Largest music box museum in Japan housed in 1912 warehouse, collection of 3,400 antique and contemporary music boxes from around the world, customization workshop to create your own box, regular concerts of historic 1908 steam organ, extensive shop, outdoor steam clock chiming every 15 minutes.

Temiya Shrine — Shinto shrine perched on hill offering panoramic view of port and Ishikari Bay, founded in 1865 to protect sailors and fishermen, steep staircase of 105 steps under vermillion torii, simple traditional wooden architecture, peaceful atmosphere away from tourist areas, cherry blossoms in May, popular spot for New Year's first visit hatsumode.

activities.text: Visit to an artisanal glassworks — Attend a glass blowing demonstration in one of Otaru's 18 workshops perpetuating a century-old tradition, glass heated to 1200 degrees shaped by master craftsmen, possibility to create your own object in 30 minutes under supervision, technique inherited from European importation during the Meiji era, shops selling unique colored lamps bowls and cups.

Tasting at Sankaku Market — Explore the triangular fish market open since 1950, stalls of king crabs and fresh sea urchins caught in the morning, restaurants offering kaisendon hearty breakfast from 6am, lively local atmosphere, reasonable prices compared to Tokyo, free sample tasting, shops selling dried products and preserves.

visits.text: Sapporo Clock Tower tour — Emblematic wooden building in American style built in 1878 as a gymnasium for Hokkaido Agricultural University, mechanical clock imported from Massachusetts functioning for 145 years, museum displaying the history of Sapporo's development, rare Western architecture from the Meiji era, important cultural property of Japan.

Odori Park — Green artery of 1.5 kilometers crossing the city center from east to west, designed in 1871 as a firebreak then transformed into a landscaped park, venue for the famous Sapporo Snow Festival in February with monumental ice sculptures, 147-meter Sapporo Television Tower at the eastern end offering urban panorama, fountains and flower gardens, relaxation spot for residents.

Sapporo Beer Museum — Japan's only beer museum housed in a former red brick brewery from 1890, exhibition on the history of Japanese beer since the Meiji era, giant copper vats, free tasting of three varieties including Sapporo Classic exclusive to Hokkaido, Biergarten restaurant serving grilled jingisukan, preserved industrial architecture.

Hokkaido Jingu Shrine — Main Shinto shrine of Hokkaido founded in 1869 dedicated to four kami including souls of the island's pioneers, nestled in the forest of 180-hectare Maruyama Park, traditional nagare-zukuri architecture in natural wood, stone lantern pathway, cherry and plum blossoms April-May, peaceful spiritual atmosphere away from urban bustle.

activities.text: Exploration of Nijo Market — Wander through Sapporo's historic food market opened in 1903, stalls overflowing with giant live king crabs, fresh sea urchins, whole salmon, scallops, kaisendon seafood bowl tasting at reasonable prices from 7am, authentic local atmosphere without mass tourists, shops selling dried products and preserves.

Ascent to JR Tower observation deck — Climb to the 38th floor of Sapporo Station tower at 160 meters altitude, JR Tower T38 observatory offering 360-degree panoramic view of the grid city and surrounding mountains, restrooms with vertiginous view, café lounge to rest, open until 11pm to admire nighttime illuminations, direct access from the station.

Night stroll in Susukino — Dive into the largest entertainment district north of Tokyo with 4000 establishments, colorful bright neon signs creating cyberpunk atmosphere, izakaya restaurants and ramen open until dawn, Norbesa tower with Noria Ferris wheel on the roof at 78 meters, historic Ganso Ramen Yokocho ramen street since 1951, vibrant secure nighttime atmosphere.

visits.text: Farm Tomita — Hokkaido's most famous flower farm founded in 1958, purple lavender fields as far as the eye can see over 15 hectares peaking in mid-July, seven multicolored Rainbow Flower Fields plots with poppies tulips salvias, intoxicating lavender fragrance, shop selling derivative products essential oils soaps, signature lavender ice cream café, view of Tokachi mountains, free admission.

Shikisai-no-oka Farm — Panoramic 15-hectare hill of flowers in rainbow horizontal strips, tulips in May, lavender in July, cosmos in September, Norokko-go tractor crossing the fields, alpacas and llamas in mini zoo, electric buggy rental, view of Mount Tokachi-dake, free entry and free visit, less crowded than Tomita.

Ningle Terrace — Fairy-tale craft village in birch forest of New Furano Prince Hotel, 15 log cottages housing leather glass wood artisan workshops, fairy tale atmosphere inspired by ningle forest spirits imagined by author Sō Kuramoto, wooden plank paths, magical nighttime illuminations, unique creative shops, forest café.

activities.text: Bike ride between flower fields — Rent an electric bike and ride the scenic route connecting Farm Tomita to Shikisai-no-oka over 6 kilometers, bucolic landscapes of multicolored patchwork fields, snow-capped mountains as backdrop, unlimited photo stops, authentic farming villages, self-service vegetable stands, famous Furano melons, easy pedaling on flat road.

Sunset at Mild Seven Hill — Admire the iconic rolling hill photographed for Mild Seven cigarette advertisements in the 1970s, seven solitary larches at the summit silhouetted against the sky, zen minimalist pastoral landscape, golden wheat and potato fields, sublime golden evening light, freely accessible, emblematic photographic spot of Hokkaido.

visits.text: Patchwork Hill — Rolling agricultural area of 3000 hectares with multicolored plots creating natural patchwork pattern, wheat potato sunflower and flower fields, scenic roads winding between hills, iconic Hokkaido view used in advertisements and films, emblematic solitary Ken and Mary Seven Star trees, landscapes changing with seasons, free accessible by car or bike.

Blue Pond Aoiike — Artificial pond created in 1988 for flood control dam that became natural attraction, unreal electric cobalt blue water caused by suspended aluminum particles, white dead tree trunks emerge creating surreal ghostly scene, MacOS wallpaper inspiration, color varying according to weather and season, wooden walking trails, magical winter illuminations.

Shirahige Waterfall — Unique 30-meter underground waterfall gushing directly from volcanic rock cliff into Biei river, milky white turquoise water due to minerals, blue suspension bridge offering plunging view, same mineral source as blue pond located 3 km downstream, preserved forest environment, easily accessible, less crowded in mornings.

activities.text: Scenic car circuit — Drive the famous Biei tree road connecting emblematic photographic spots Seven Star Tree solitary cedar, Ken and Mary Tree poplar, Parent and Child Tree, Philosopher's Tree five larches, perfect bucolic landscapes between multicolored rolling fields, frequent photo stops, 20-kilometer circuit requires 2 to 3 hours with breaks.

Visit to Selection Biei — Art photography gallery shop exhibiting shots by professionals capturing the beauty of Biei landscapes in four seasons, large format prints sold, advice for photographing hills at the best golden light moment, café with valley panorama, local artisan products, inspiring atmosphere for photographers.

visits.text: Asahiyama Zoo — Revolutionary design zoo opened in 1967, innovative installations allowing observation of animals' natural behaviors, underwater tunnel with seals, polar bear enclosure with immersive dome, penguins walking freely in winter, red pandas gibbons wolves, 2nd most visited zoo in Japan after Ueno, educational and conservation mission, natural hilly forest setting.

Kamikawa Shrine — Shinto shrine built in 1893 at the confluence of the Ishikari and Chubetsu rivers, spiritual guardian of Asahikawa city, imposing vermillion torii, traditional cedar wood architecture, annual matsuri festival in September, cherry trees lining access path blooming in late April, serene local atmosphere not touristy, view of Mount Ohiradake.

Takasago Sake Museum — Historic sake brewery founded in 1899 still in operation, red brick building in Western style classified as heritage, exhibition on traditional brewing process using Hokkaido rice and pure snowmelt water, free tasting of six award-winning sakes, extensive shop, izakaya restaurant serving local cuisine ideal accompaniment, warm atmosphere.

activities.text: Asahikawa ramen tour — Taste the local shoyu ramen style pioneer of Hokkaido since 1947, double pork-fish soup broth with aromatic soy sauce, thin wavy noodles, grilled chashu, six to eight famous restaurants concentrated in Asahikawa Ramen Village, unique family variations, nostalgic Showa atmosphere, generous portions comforting against winter cold.

Night walk at Snow Crystal Museum — Discover unique thematic museum dedicated to snow crystals research of Dr. Nakaya native of Asahikawa, whimsical ice castle architecture, hexagonal hall with 200 macro photographs of snowflakes, temperature maintained at minus 20 degrees, video projection of crystal formation, ice princess dresses rental for photos, fascinating Japanese kitsch.

itineraries.title: Okinawa & the Ryukyu Islands: ancestral culture and turquoise seas

visits.text: Kokusai Street Shopping District, main street with 600 shops

Tsuboya Pottery District with 400m stone-paved street and yachimun workshops
Naminoue Shrine standing majestically on blue ocean cliffs

activities.text: Explore 1.6km shopping street with restaurants, souvenirs and cafes

visits.text: Shuri Castle Park, unique red vermillion castle symbolizing Okinawa

activities.text: Explore political and cultural center of 450-year Ryukyu Kingdom

Walk 300m limestone path designated as prefectural scenic spot

visits.text: Umikaji Terrace on Senaga Island with Mediterranean-style white buildings

activities.text: Enjoy resort atmosphere inspired by Amalfi Coast and Santorini

visits.text: Sefa Utaki, most sacred site of Ryukyu Kingdom, UNESCO World Heritage

activities.text: Worship sacred Kudaka Island from ancient prayer site

visits.text: American Village resort with American-style streetscape

activities.text: Shop and dine in resort built on former US military airfield

activities.text: Experience Dinosaur Safari with 20 life-size dinosaurs

Experience the main shrine of Kibi Province

visits.text: Kurashiki Bikan Historical Quarter with white-walled warehouses
Ohara Museum of Art, Japan's first private Western art museum
Kurashiki Ivy Square converted from Meiji-era factory

activities.text: Stroll along willow-lined Kurashiki River with traditional buildings
Experience retro-modern atmosphere popular with tourists
Explore charming shops in renovated historic warehouses
Discover the emotional townscape of white walls and namako walls

visits.text: Bitchu Matsuyama Castle, only remaining original mountain castle in Japan
Castle floating in sea of clouds at 480m elevation

activities.text: Climb to Japan's highest existing castle tower
View siege preparation rooms and great hall with irori hearth
Experience the mystical floating castle phenomenon
See two-story tower, double turret, and earthen walls

visits.text: Atomic Bomb Dome, UNESCO World Heritage Site preserving 1945 bombing
Hiroshima Peace Memorial Museum documenting atomic bomb devastation
Hiroshima Castle built by Mori Terumoto in 1589

activities.text: Visit Peace Memorial Park and ring the Peace Bell
Learn history at museum with victim belongings and photographs
See Japanese swords and armor in castle museum exhibition
View Hiroshima cityscape from castle observation deck
Reflect on peace at this precious historical site

visits.text: Itsukushima Shrine, UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1996
Great Torii gate standing in the sea, restored in 2022

activities.text: View shrine buildings designated as National Treasures
See vermillion torii gate after Reiwa restoration
Experience the sacred island called Island of the Gods
Admire autumn foliage at one of Japan's top autumn color spots

visits.text: Tomonoura historic port mentioned in Manyoshu poetry collection
Kintaikyo Bridge, one of Japan's Three Famous Bridges

activities.text: Explore port used as Hollywood film and anime location
See Sensuijima and Bentenjima islands in peaceful Seto Inland Sea
Cross 193.3m five-arch wooden bridge with unique construction
View bridge from below to see interlocking woodwork technique

visits.text: Rurikoji Temple Five-Story Pagoda, National Treasure and one of Japan's Three Famous Pagodas
Akiyoshidai Karst Plateau, largest in Japan formed 300 million years ago

activities.text: View 31.2m pagoda completed in 1442 with cypress bark roof
Experience vast grassland with white limestone rocks
Learn about coral reef transformation into karst landscape
Admire elegant Japanese architectural style with some Chinese elements

visits.text: Motonosumi Shrine with 123 vermillion torii gates overlooking the sea
Tsunoshima Bridge, 1,780m connecting to isolated island

activities.text: Throw offering into 6m high torii gate for wishes to come true
View breathtaking scenery of torii gates against cobalt blue sea
Drive photogenic bridge only 18m above sea surface
Pray for business prosperity, fishing, maritime safety, and romance
Experience one of Japan's longest free toll bridges to isolated islands

itineraries.title: Tokai & the Japanese Alps: sacred waterfalls, crystal-clear seas and traditional villages

visits.text: Shiraito Falls, selected among Japan's 100 Best Waterfalls
Curved cliff face 20m high and 150m wide with ribbon-like cascades

activities.text: View water fed by Mt. Fuji springs at 1.5 tons per second
See crystal clear pool at the base of falls
Experience refreshing 11-degree water temperature even in summer
Absorb negative ions for rejuvenation

visits.text: Hirizo Beach with 5-meter water visibility
Coral reefs and diverse marine life resembling tropical paradise

activities.text: Snorkeling in crystal clear waters open mid-July to mid-September
View spectacular sunset from observation platform
Enjoy beach with lifeguard supervision safe for solo travelers

visits.text: Sumata Gorge stretching over 16km with Dream Suspension Bridge
90m long, 8m high bridge over cobalt blue lake
Okuoikojo Station appearing to float on emerald green lake

activities.text: Walk across thrilling suspension bridge with panoramic views
Make a wish at bridge center for love blessing power spot
Enjoy 360-degree views from rainbow bridge at station
Visit heart-shaped key monument symbolizing love wishes
Best season April to June for green foliage contrast

visits.text: Mount Chausu, highest peak in Aichi Prefecture
Celestial Flower Corridor with 400,000 moss phlox flowers

activities.text: View pink shibazakura hillside late April to early June
See gradient of pink, white, light blue, and purple flowers
Find hidden heart-shaped spot for romance luck
Enjoy seasonal activities: fruit picking, BBQ, skiing

visits.text: Korankei, premier autumn foliage spot in Tokai region
4,000 maple trees of 11 varieties

activities.text: View Japanese maple, mountain maple, and Acer japonicum varieties
Experience Maple Festival with various events in November
See stunning nighttime illuminations
Admire color gradients unique to each tree species

visits.text: Irago Cape Lighthouse, symbol of Atsumi Peninsula
Selected among Japan's 50 Best Lighthouses

activities.text: View panorama of Pacific Ocean, Ise Bay, and Mikawa Bay
Watch sunset coloring everything in orange
See sunrise through Hinode Stone Gate cave in October and February
Visit Koiji Beach sacred lovers spot and Hinode Stone Gate power spot

visits.text: Tsushima Tenno Wisteria Festival with 12 varieties
Giant wisteria trellis 275m long covering 5,034 square meters

activities.text: Walk under purple curtain of countless hanging wisteria flowers
Enjoy color gradients from various wisteria varieties
Experience magical nighttime illuminations
Visit Owari Tsushima Wisteria Festival late April to early May

visits.text: Yoro Falls, selected among Japan's 100 Best Waterfalls
Historic falls beloved by literary masters

activities.text: View powerful waterfall from close-up vantage point
Feel negative ions from premier Tokai waterfall
See fresh green trees contrasting with falls in season
Attend Yoro Falls Opening ceremony in July

visits.text: Monet's Pond with high transparency water and water lilies
Colorful koi swimming through lily pads like a painting

activities.text: View pond resembling Monet's famous paintings
See water surface change color with sunlight angles
Visit June to September for peak water lily season
Come in morning for fewer crowds and open lily flowers

visits.text: Shirakawa-go UNESCO World Heritage Site
114 traditional gassho-zukuri thatched roof farmhouses

activities.text: Experience time-slip atmosphere in preserved village
View winter illumination with snow-covered houses
See upside-down reflection of farmhouses in water
Try mountain village cuisine and gassho-zukuri accommodation
Explore miraculous landscape in all seasons

visits.text: Inabe Plum Grove, largest in Tokai region at 38 hectares
100 varieties and over 4,000 plum trees

activities.text: View red, pink, and white gradient from hilltop observatory
Smell delicate plum fragrance across the grounds
See Suzuka Mountains backdrop behind plum groves
Attend Ume Matsuri early to late March with plum picking

visits.text: Akame 48 Waterfalls Gorge stretching 4km
Selected among 100 Best Waters, Waterfalls, Forest Bathing spots

activities.text: View Akame Five Waterfalls, the most beautiful cascades
See Ninai Falls split into two streams, symbol of the gorge
Hike beginner to advanced trekking courses
Experience different scenery each season

visits.text: Meoto Iwa (Married Rocks) sacred power spot in Futami
Ancient sunrise worship site with divine presence legend

activities.text: View sunrise between the rocks May to July
See full moon between rocks autumn to winter
Witness shimenawa rope replacement ceremony in May, September, December
Experience blessing for eternal happiness when viewing with loved one

visits.text: Goza Shirahama Beach, highest transparency in Tokai
Selected among 100 Best Swimming Beaches, famous surfing spot

activities.text: Enjoy white sand and cobalt blue water like overseas resort
Swim in shallow, calm waves safe for children
Use well-maintained facilities for family or girls trips
Try surfing at popular wave spot

itineraries.title: Kanto: spectacular flowers & unique natural landscapes

visits.text: Hitachi Seaside Park with 4.5 million nemophila flowers
Miharashi Hill covered in vibrant blue mid-April to early May

activities.text: Photograph gradient of blue flowers merging with sky and sea
Explore seasonal flower displays throughout the 350-hectare park
Enjoy Instagram-worthy scenery perfect for day trips

visits.text: Fukuroda Falls, one of Japan's three famous waterfalls
120 meters high and 73 meters wide cascading falls

activities.text: View falls from first observation deck below
Visit second observation deck built in 2008 for panoramic views
Admire autumn foliage framing the powerful waterfall
Experience nighttime illuminations from November to late winter

visits.text: Kasama Azalea Park at 143 meters elevation
8,500 azaleas of 25 varieties covering the hillside

activities.text: Visit Azalea Festival from mid-April to mid-May
View red landscape stretching as far as the eye can see
Watch sunset from elevated viewpoint for romantic atmosphere
Photograph panoramic hilltop views

visits.text: Ashikaga Flower Park with spectacular wisteria displays
Great Wisteria trellis spanning 600 tatami mats
160cm flower clusters of Noda Wisteria and 80m white wisteria tunnel

activities.text: View peak wisteria blooms late April to mid-May
See O-Fuji wisteria designated as prefectural natural monument
Experience magical nighttime illuminations after sunset
Explore 94,000 square meter garden featured on American television

visits.text: Kegon Falls, one of Japan's three great waterfalls, 97 meters high
48 waterfalls scattered throughout Nikko area

activities.text: Take elevator to observation platform for close-up views
Feel thundering water spray and sound up close
Visit during fresh green season for enhanced experience
Recharge at this powerful spiritual power spot

visits.text: Oze Marshland, Ramsar Convention registered wetland
2km x 6km area with colorful alpine flowers

activities.text: See yellow Nikko day lilies in full bloom during early summer
Enjoy beautiful contrast of flowers against blue sky
Hike beginner-friendly trails with unobstructed views
Experience open atmosphere of vast marshland

visits.text: Lake Okushima with famous Shima Blue turquoise waters
4km circumference dam lake with miraculous blue color

activities.text: Marvel at deep turquoise blue water so clear you can see the bottom
Visit in spring for most beautiful scenery
Combine with nearby Shima Onsen hot springs
Photograph the miraculous blue created by chemical reactions

visits.text: Lake Akagi Onuma Ice Bubbles winter phenomenon
Largest caldera lake on Mount Akagi

activities.text: View mystical ice bubbles trapped in frozen lake surface
See gas bubbles from lake bottom frozen in ice like outer space
Visit during low snowfall season when ice reflects like mirror
Experience rare natural phenomenon only visible in Kanto

visits.text: Hitsujiyama Park Moss Phlox Hill with 400,000+ flowers
9 varieties of pink shibazakura covering gentle slopes
Misotsuchi Icicles, Japan's largest at 30m wide and 10m tall
Nagatoro River with 500m Iwadatami rock formations

activities.text: View pink flower carpet mid-April to early May
Find hidden heart-shaped spot for romance luck
Experience illuminated icicles in red, blue, yellow, orange
Go river rafting past National Natural Monument rock formations
Try famous Kakko Dango sweets

visits.text: Showa Kinen Park with 200m golden ginkgo avenue
Vast grounds spanning two baseball stadium areas
Nippara Limestone Cave, one of Japan's 7 great caves, 800m long

activities.text: Walk through golden ginkgo tunnel early to late November
Experience seasonal flower displays and nature activities
Explore adventure-filled cave with colorful LED-lit formations
Visit Shidenorama illuminated formation inside cave
Combine with stream fishing and hot springs nearby

visits.text: Isumi Railway canola flower fields with retro trains
Ishigami canola flower field photogenic spot

activities.text: Photograph trains running through yellow canola fields
Capture collaboration of flowers, blue sky, and vintage train
See sea poles reflected on water surface at high tide
Visit 1-2 hours before low tide for mirror effect

visits.text: Mount Nokogiri with Hell Peek cliff viewpoint at 330m

activities.text: Experience thrilling Hell Peek jutting rock platform
Look down from cliff for stomach-dropping sensation
Take ropeway to summit viewing platform
Hike beginner to advanced trails through the mountain

visits.text: Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse historic buildings

activities.text: Stroll through European-style Christmas market in winter
Photograph illuminated brick buildings at night
Take 10-minute ferry to former fortress island
Explore moss-covered brick tunnels at Mitsumataji junction
Experience otherworldly atmosphere of abandoned military ruins

visits.text: Sengokuhara Pampas Grass Fields in Hakone

activities.text: View golden pampas grass late September to early November
Watch grass sway gently in the breeze
Photograph color changes from silver to gold as autumn deepens
Experience different scenery from blue skies to sunset

visits.text: Ogasawara Islands UNESCO World Heritage Site

activities.text: Flight to Ogasawara (or 24-hour ferry from Tokyo)
Experience untouched nature of remote southern paradise
Visit uninhabited Minamijima island surrounded by rocks
Enjoy exclusive scenery on pristine uninhabited island
Refresh away from city bustle in unique ecosystem

itineraries.title: Tohoku: mystical lakes and volcanic scenery

visits.text: Miharu Takizakura, one of Japan's three great cherry trees over 1,000 years old
Weeping cherry tree with 13.5m height, 11.3m root circumference, 9.5m trunk circumference

activities.text: View cherry blossoms in mid-April peak season

Photograph contrast of pink blossoms against blue sky

visits.text: Goshikinuma Five-Colored Lakes, 30+ mystical ponds in Urabandai
Bishamonnuma Pond with emerald green waters

activities.text: View panoramic collaboration of ponds with Mt. Bandai

visits.text: Nunobiki Plateau at 1,000m elevation with 33 wind turbines

activities.text: View 200,000 sunflowers blooming mid-August to early September

Experience Tohoku's representative sunflower field

visits.text: Matsushima Bay, one of Japan's three most scenic views
Over 260 pine-covered islands in the bay

activities.text: Cruise around the bay viewing island formations
Watch sunset transform the bay into postcard scenery
Experience landscapes praised by famous poets throughout history

visits.text: Naruko Gorge V-shaped valley with 100m+ cliff walls

activities.text: View panoramic autumn colors mid-October to early November

Relax in Naruko Onsen hot springs after hiking
Discover Kokeshi doll craftsmanship in the village

visits.text: Okama Crater Lake at Zao mountain summit

activities.text: View lake changing colors with seasons and weather
Walk barrier-free path to observation deck
Marvel at seven-colored scenery of the mystical lake
Visit nearby Zao Onsen hot springs

visits.text: Zao Ice Monsters (Juhyo) snow-covered trees on mountain slopes

activities.text: Ride ropeway to view ice monsters from above
Experience nighttime illumination of snow formations
Learn how Siberian winds create natural ice art
Ski or snowboard among the ice monsters

visits.text: Ginzan Onsen with Taisho-era wooden ryokan inns

activities.text: Stroll streets lined with historic wooden buildings
View gas lamps illuminating snowy winter scenery at night
Experience romantic atmosphere featured in dramas and anime
Soak in hot springs while enjoying the retro townscape

visits.text: Lake Tazawa, deepest lake in Japan with lapis lazuli blue waters

activities.text: Take sightseeing boat cruise around the lake
View collaboration of blue lake with majestic mountains
Experience seasonal changes: fresh green, autumn leaves, snow
Visit nearby Nyuto Onsen hidden hot spring village

visits.text: Dakigaeri Gorge with original forest and cobalt blue stream

activities.text: Walk trails viewing blue river and mountain scenery
Photograph unique rock formations and waterfalls
Experience seasonal changes in greenery and autumn colors
Visit samurai district of Kakunodate nearby

visits.text: Yokote Kamakura Festival with 100 snow igloos over 3m tall

activities.text: View 2,000 mini kamakura illuminated by candles at night

Try building mini kamakura snow dome
Feel warm glow of winter tradition in February

visits.text: Genbikei Gorge along 2km of Iwai River

activities.text: Walk trails viewing rugged rocks and clear blue river

visits.text: Ryusendo Cave, one of Japan's three largest limestone caves

activities.text: Explore 700m of open cave passages
Marvel at deep blue underground lake waters
View LED-lit Gekkuden Moon Palace formation
Participate in seasonal cave events

visits.text: Hachimantai Dragon Eye at mountain summit
Kagaminuma Pond creating dragon eye illusion when snow melts

activities.text: View rare phenomenon of blue water and white snow creating dragon eye
Visit only during brief snow-melt season in late May to early June
Take aerial view for dramatic dragon eye shape
Soak in nearby hot springs

visits.text: Oirase Gorge, 14km stream from Lake Towada, National Natural Monument
Multiple waterfalls along upper, middle, and lower stream sections

activities.text: Walk well-maintained hiking trails through pristine nature
Photograph cascading waterfalls amid lush greenery
Visit late May to early June for best fresh green scenery
Experience autumn foliage reflecting in stream waters

visits.text: Tsuta Marsh at foot of Mt. Hakkoda
Hidden gem with beech forests reflecting on water

activities.text: Visit mid to late October for peak autumn colors
Photograph mirror reflection of red and orange foliage on calm water
Arrive at sunrise for magical light on autumn leaves
Experience rare scenery visible only on windless days

visits.text: Hirosaki Castle Cherry Blossom Festival with 2,600 trees of 52 varieties
One of Japan's top three cherry blossom viewing spots

activities.text: View cherry blossom tunnels along west moat
See flower rafts floating in outer moat
Experience nighttime illumination creating fairytale atmosphere
Visit late April to early May during Sakura Festival

visits.text: Aoike Blue Pond in Shirakami-Sanchi World Heritage Site
Most beautiful of the Juniko Twelve Lakes

activities.text: Marvel at crystal clear blue water surface
Experience color changes from bright blue in morning to deep blue in afternoon
Relax surrounded by pristine World Heritage nature
Visit closed December to April for winter

itineraries.title: Extreme Hokkaidō: arctic panoramas, sacred volcanoes & natural wonders

visits.text: Mount Hakodate observatory at 334 meters altitude
Million dollar night view with city lights between two seas

activities.text: Take ropeway to summit for panoramic night view
Observe Tsugaru Strait on left and Hakodate Bay on right
Experience romantic atmosphere of starry city lights

visits.text: Cape Chikyu overlooking Pacific Ocean from Etomo Peninsula
Observation deck on cliff with 360-degree curved horizon view

activities.text: Feel the roundness of the Earth from the panoramic viewpoint
Spot dolphins and whales during migration season
View sea of clouds forming below the cape

visits.text: Otaru Canal, 1,140 meters long completed in 1923

activities.text: Stroll cobblestone streets with Taisho era romantic atmosphere
Admire orange gas lamps illuminating the canal at night
Photograph illuminated warehouses reflecting on water

visits.text: Cape Kamui extending into Sea of Japan on Shakotan Peninsula
Kamui Rock with tragic legend of Charenka

activities.text: Hike Charenka no Michi trail along ridge to cape tip
Enjoy 300-degree panoramic ocean view with curved horizon
Admire Shakotan Blue crystal clear waters rivaling tropical seas
See yellow daylilies blooming in summer

visits.text: Hokuryu Sunflower Village with 1.5 million sunflowers
Largest sunflower fields in Japan covering five Tokyo Domes

activities.text: Walk through golden fields rivaling Provence and Andalusia

Visit during short summer season only

visits.text: Furano lavender fields in deep purple covering the region
Lavender farms in Furano, Nakafurano, and Kamifurano

activities.text: Visit early morning when flowers glisten with dew
Experience aromatherapy effects of lavender scent
View mountain ridges from hilltops with lavender foreground
Best viewing in July at peak bloom

visits.text: Shirogane Blue Pond with mysterious cobalt blue water
Patchwork Road through potato and wheat fields
Shikisai no Oka flower garden on Panorama Road

activities.text: Photograph dead larches emerging from blue colloidal waters
Visit Blue Pond early morning on clear windless days for best color
Drive through rolling hills resembling European countryside
See dozens of seasonal flowers blooming spring to autumn

visits.text: Mount Asahi, highest peak of Daisetsuzan at 2,291 meters
Kagami-ike and Suribachi-ike crater ponds
Sugatami-no-ike reflecting Mount Asahi

activities.text: Take ropeway to 1,600 meters and hike through alpine nature
Spot Hokkaido deer and chipmunks
See rare Aleutian flower fields blooming briefly in summer
Admire crystal clear pond waters fed by rain and snowmelt

visits.text: Sounkyo Gorge with 24 km of steep cliffs along Ishikari River
Ginga Falls and Ryusei Falls
Cliffs towering 200 meters in Daisetsuzan National Park

activities.text: View autumn foliage coloring the cliff faces in red and yellow

Visit late September to early October for peak autumn colors
Experience one of Japan's earliest autumn foliage spots

visits.text: Unkai Terrace at 1,088 meters in Hoshino Resort Tomamu
Sea of clouds observation platform

activities.text: Wake early morning for 30-40% chance to see sea of clouds
Watch ethereal cloud formations from above June to September
Experience unforgettable moment if lucky enough to witness phenomenon

visits.text: Mikuni Pass, highest pass in Hokkaido at 1,139 meters
Taushubetsu River Bridge, phantom concrete arch bridge
Matsumi Ohashi Bridge and Midorifuka observation point

activities.text: Admire deep green Yezo spruce and Sakhalin fir forest
View autumn foliage late September to early October
See ghost bridge emerging from water January to August
Join guided tour to approach deteriorating Roman aqueduct-style bridge

visits.text: Lake Mashu, most transparent lake in Japan and second in world
Sacred lake of the Ainu people with deep Mashu Blue waters

activities.text: Visit on clear day to see famous deep blue Mashu color
See into lake depths from the surface
Experience mystical foggy lake atmosphere on misty days
Marvel at constant water level despite no tributaries

visits.text: Kushiro Wetlands covering 60% of Japan's wetland area
Habitat for over 2,000 species of plants and animals

activities.text: Walk boardwalks with 360-degree views of lush vegetation
Spot protected red-crowned cranes in the wetland
Ride Kushiro Wetland Norokko sightseeing train through greenery
Experience vast carpet of verdant nature

visits.text: Shiretoko Five Lakes in UNESCO World Heritage primeval forest
Shiretoko mountain range reflected in pristine lakes
Eight Views of Shiretoko scenic spots

activities.text: Walk nature trails through untouched virgin forest
Experience sunlight filtering through deep green canopy
Spot Ezo red foxes, Hokkaido deer, and Hokkaido squirrels
Watch for brown bears and exercise caution
View majestic Hokkaido landscape from observation platform

visits.text: Abashiri drift ice covering Sea of Okhotsk

activities.text: Board icebreaker cruise through frozen sea late January to mid-March
Spot seals basking on ice floes
Experience magic and grandeur of nature's winter spectacle
Witness ice sheets from Siberia covering the ocean

visits.text: Cape Kimuneup extending into Lake Saroma
Red coral grass fields creating crimson carpet mid-September to early October

activities.text: View spectacular Lake Saroma panorama
Photograph fiery red grass covering the landscape
Watch swans resting during winter migration
See sunset reflecting on lake with swan silhouettes
Camp in summer by the lakeside

visits.text: Soya Hills behind Cape Soya, northernmost point of Japan
Gentle rolling hills formed 20,000 years ago during Ice Age
57 wind turbines turning slowly in the breeze

activities.text: Watch cows grazing on alpine plant-covered hills
Walk the northernmost White Road paved with scallop shells
Feel refreshing breeze unique to Soya Hills
Experience serene landscape at Japan's northern frontier

visits.text: Teuri Island Akaiwa Observatory, world's largest puffin breeding site

activities.text: Take ferry from Haboro Port to 15 km circumference island
Watch puffins return at sunset with fish for chicks

Photograph majestic puffins standing vertically on water
